intro: Malvastrum cordifolium, commonly known as the heartleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is known for its soft, hairy stems and foliage. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils. Malvastrum cordifolium is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
